suncertify.gui
Class AbstractTextChecker

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.gui.AbstractTextChecker
All Implemented Interfaces:
TextChecker
public abstract class AbstractTextChecker
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextChecker

This abstract text checker class provides a default implementation for the TextChecker interface.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner

Method Detail

isValidInputCharacter

public boolean isValidInputCharacter(char c,
                                     int offs)
Description copied from interface: TextChecker
Validity check for a single input character. A character that does not pass this check is not accepted as a valid input character of the corresponding CheckedTextField.

Specified by:
isValidInputCharacter in interface TextChecker
Parameters:
c - he character to be checked
offs - the offset or position of the character among the input field text
Returns:
true if c is a valid input character to be accepted, false if c is to be rejected as invalid (and thus not to be displayed)

isValidFieldText

public boolean isValidFieldText(java.lang.String fieldText)
Description copied from interface: TextChecker
Validity check for the overall field text. Whenever the validity state changes, either from invalid to valid or vice versa, a validity change event is triggered that can be handled by registering a validity change listener for a checked text field. Called on each new character input or delete operation.

Specified by:
isValidFieldText in interface TextChecker
Parameters:
fieldText - the text to be checked
Returns:
true if fieldText is considered valid, false otherwise (if fieldText is considered invalid)
See Also:
ValidityChangeListener
